name: Hardest 'King of the Hill' - 'Hank's Got the Willies' Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Hank's Got the Willies' opens with a dream, Hank Hill's dream; a perfect scene of tranquillity on a golf course.  Hank and Willie Nelson are playing golf together in Hank's dream at Willie's country club.  What is the club called?
questions.explanation:
Pedernales.

	Willie Nelson's Pedernales Country Club, to be more precise.  The sign at the entrance reads: No spittin', fightin', gamblin' (heh heh), (and no) more than 12 in your foursome.   In his dream, Hank learns that Willie Nelson's dream career involves selling propane and propane accessories.

questions.text: This episode features one of Hank's most prized possessions, his 1963 Guild solid top guitar.  What is the guitar's name?
questions.explanation:
Betsy.

	Hank is rudely awakened from his gentle slumber by the sounds of a guitar being abused.  It turns out that Bobby has found a new use for the beloved musical instrument.  Read on...

questions.text: With which food item does Bobby Hill strum Hank's precious guitar?
questions.explanation:
Cheese.

	Bobby Hill is inspired by a new joke he has developed.  He claims that he is using cheese to strum the guitar because his rock music name is Eddie Cheddar (a play on the name Eddie Vedder).  Hank is not amused.

questions.text: Bobby Hill talks about one of his comic heroes during the early portion of the episode.  Which 'famous' comedian does Bobby try to emulate?
questions.explanation:
Celery Head.

	Celery Head is the 'King of the Hill' version of the comedian Carrot Top, who uses stage props for comic effect.  Hank Hill later refers to him mistakenly as 'Broccoli Neck'. Both Bobby and Peg are particularly impressed by the fact that Celery Head makes three million dollars a year.

questions.text: Dale Gribble is always afraid he is being watched.  During this episode, he reveals the object of his recent paranoia.  What would this be?
questions.correct: Stealth helicopters with computerized noise-cancellation capability
options: Indetectable FBI agents, made invisible by the bending of the visible light spectrum
Microscopic bugs that can be implanted in ham sandwiches
Intelligent hamsters, trained to infiltrate and, when needed, kill
questions.explanation:
Stealth helicopters with computerized noise-cancellation capability.

	Dale has read all about these 'stealth helicopters' on the website 'alt.conspiracy.black.helicopters'.  Of course, Dale isn't the most reliable person for accurate information.

questions.text: In the car, Bobby and Hank discuss the virtues of Willie Nelson's music.  Bobby describes Willie as being in which musical genre?
questions.explanation:
Alternative.

	Hank is stunned by Bobby's suggestion that Willie Nelson is 'alternative'.  He suggests to his son that Willie has made moves in genre over time, but only from country to country-western, and finally to adult contemporary (and that's as far as Hank is willing to go).

questions.text: Hank is concerned about Bobby having a hero to look up to, and he discusses this with his beer buddies.  Who does Bill suggest could make a good hero for Bobby?
questions.explanation:
Santa Claus.

	Santa Claus is Bill's idea of a hero, but ultimately we discover that Hank Hill is the ideal hero for Bobby, thanks to the wisdom of Willie Nelson.

questions.text: Hank Hill claims to have seen Willie Nelson in concert a number of times, including attendance at every Farm Aid but one.  Hank avoided Farm Aid one year because he doesn't like the music of which performer(s)?
questions.explanation:
Bryan Adams.

	For some reason, Hank Hill is not a Bryan Adams fan, but there is no explanation as to why.  Willie Nelson is flattered by Hank's devotion to his music.

questions.text: Most of the 'King of the Hill' cast is invited to a get-together, hosted by Willie Nelson.  There we see various celebrities intermingling with the locals.  Which legendary songwriter has a mumbling conversation with the Boomhauer?
questions.explanation:
Bob Dylan.

	Boomhauer and Bob Dylan have a very amusing conversation in which their discussion is barely discernable.  Unfortunately, the voice of Bob Dylan was not provided by the songwriter himself for this episode, but rather a voice actor.

questions.text: Peggy Hill has a conversation with the oddly charming Dennis Hopper at the party.  Does Dennis Hopper provide his own voice for this episode?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Indeed, Dennis Hopper appears as a guest voice alongside Willie Nelson.  In his conversation with Peggy, Dennis suggests that the two of them run off to Mexico together. I hope you have enjoyed this quiz, thank you for playing.
